title: Apple exec exits after coarse remarks in viral TikTok video: report; Procurement executive seemingly attempted to quote the movie 'Arthur' when approached at car show, leading to reported pushback from Apple employees
text:
His co-workers did not find it humorous, according to a Bloomberg News report. Following an internal investigation into the matter, Blevins's team of about half a dozen direct reports and several hundred employees were removed from his overview, according to the report.

Apple did not immediately respond to an email message seeking comment. Blevins confirmed the incident to Bloomberg, saying "I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologize to anyone who was offended by my mistaken attempt at humor."

The TikTok video — reportedly shot at a car show last month in Pebble Beach, Calif. — collected more than 1.3 million views on TikTok. It also became an angry topic of discussion among Apple employees, who reportedly noted that Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook and Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams have publicly championed workforce diversity and the empowerment of women, according to Bloomberg's anonymous sources.

A 22-year veteran of Apple, Blevins played a crucial role in reducing costs of many critical parts that go into Apple's mobile devices. He also helped negotiate Apple's satellite agreement with Globalstar Inc. GSAT, as well as deals over cellular modems with Intel Corp. INTC and Qualcomm Inc. QCOM
